metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15587 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
GNOME Evolution through 3.28.2 is prone to OpenPGP signatures being spoofedfor arbitrary messages using a specially crafted email that contains avalid signature from the entity to be impersonated as an attachment.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15587` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

evolution-data-server - 3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
evolution-data-server-common - 3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
evolution-data-server-online-accounts - 3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.2

criterions.comment: evolution: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
evolution-data-server package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
